channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @polypeptoad I suspect that the rabbi will likely be able to find someone willing to walk you home, and wouldn’t at all mind the request.
item.source:markdown: @polypeptoad I suspect that the rabbi will likely be able to find someone willing to walk you home, and wouldn’t at all mind the request.

item.description: @cooperlund “Getting stoned”
item.source:markdown: @cooperlund “Getting stoned”

item.description:
@trekonomics Is that prediction based on mass death, or just mass voluntary adoption of a one-child policy?

@trekonomics Maybe it’s unfair extrapolation from my own child rearing experience, but I find it hard to believe that a wealthy society that wanted a 2.1 child policy couldn’t achieve one by socializing the various costs involved.

@trekonomics “Refocusing on the danger of demographic decline, Space Karen donates to party committed to funding social science research and paid parental leave.”

In which the Czar’s government censors Jewish texts, including commentaries on Maimonides, for failing to oppose “sodomy” between a husband and wife. https://t.co/KTHDl3vEhC

Maybe Meir Soloveitchik ought to make sure that his Tikvah pal Gov. DeSantis has no plans to do the same, given his desire for the state to enforce perverse Christian sexual morality and opposition to a federal right of marital privacy.
item.source:markdown:
In which the Czar’s government censors Jewish texts, including commentaries on Maimonides, for failing to oppose “sodomy” between a husband and wife. https://t.co/KTHDl3vEhC
Maybe Meir Soloveitchik ought to make sure that his Tikvah pal Gov. DeSantis has no plans to do the same, given his desire for the state to enforce perverse Christian sexual morality and opposition to a federal right of marital privacy.

item.description: @MisfitTorah This is the flip side to raising more religious Jews that Torah uMesorah absolutely did not see coming.
item.source:markdown: @MisfitTorah This is the flip side to raising more religious Jews that Torah uMesorah absolutely did not see coming.

item.description: @datadivajf @MarisaElana They’re not trying to proselytize with this mailing — just get donations.
item.source:markdown: @datadivajf @MarisaElana They’re not trying to proselytize with this mailing — just get donations.

item.description: @datadivajf @MarisaElana Mailing lists are for sale. Question is whether it was a “Jewish names” list, or a Jewish organizational list. Whichever, I assume it’s the same way that AIPAC and JNF know to mail me stuff.
item.source:markdown: @datadivajf @MarisaElana Mailing lists are for sale. Question is whether it was a “Jewish names” list, or a Jewish organizational list. Whichever, I assume it’s the same way that AIPAC and JNF know to mail me stuff.

item.description: @MarisaElana But do you love $200 hotel savings?
item.source:markdown: @MarisaElana But do you love $200 hotel savings?

item.description: @datadivajf @MarisaElana Are you referring to the anti-Biden “pro-Israel” mailing from the Messianics?
item.source:markdown: @datadivajf @MarisaElana Are you referring to the anti-Biden “pro-Israel” mailing from the Messianics?

item.description:
@saulnoamz Did you see the Lipa commercial for CBD gum?

@saulnoamz https://t.co/jsjMazlBY6

@saulnoamz Imagine telling Abbie Hoffman that in 50 years time chassidim would be producing Yiddish commercials for cannabis products!

“I heard the good news today from Senator Grassley and Senator Cruz and many voices more: The Lord be praised, President Biden is starting a new army, 87,000 strong, and all armed, to work for the IRS. They shall burst into homes and knock down doors…” https://t.co/hMss1dsNg9
item.source:markdown: “I heard the good news today from Senator Grassley and Senator Cruz and many voices more: The Lord be praised, President Biden is starting a new army, 87,000 strong, and all armed, to work for the IRS. They shall burst into homes and knock down doors…” https://t.co/hMss1dsNg9

item.description: @scottEmovienerd @swordsjew Then what incentive would people have to enter medicine?
item.source:markdown: @scottEmovienerd @swordsjew Then what incentive would people have to enter medicine?

item.description:
@HannahLebovits No such thing as general interest.

@HannahLebovits If you want the largest possible niche audience, you should probably draft it as Amish Christian Romance, saving the scholarly references for the back-of-book Book Club Discussion Guide.

@HannahLebovits Contemporary religious community x Jews x sociology of social capital is probably a decent niche.
@dzkalman But did they lead you to the Prophets?
item.source:markdown: @dzkalman But did they lead you to the Prophets?

item.description: @UnnamedDem @JeffreyASachs Will nobody think of the garage elevator installers?
item.source:markdown: @UnnamedDem @JeffreyASachs Will nobody think of the garage elevator installers?

item.description:
@trekonomics @SmithsonianMag “The lion will lie down with the lamb, but the lamb won’t get much sleep,” to quote the sage.

@trekonomics @SmithsonianMag On the other hand, the lamb is less likely to get prion disease.
item.source:markdown:
@trekonomics @SmithsonianMag “The lion will lie down with the lamb, but the lamb won’t get much sleep,” to quote the sage.
@trekonomics @SmithsonianMag On the other hand, the lamb is less likely to get prion disease.

item.description: @EladNehorai Here in the Forward. From Livingston, making her pro-bagel and Jewish adjacent, but apparently not appropriate for profiling in the NJ @JewishStandard https://t.co/NXgQFTYU10

item.description:
@trekonomics Instead of Longtermism, we need Zeydeism — how can we make the best future for our grandchildren and their peers 75 years hence?

@trekonomics The flip side is that the whole enlightenment project of working toward a better future is only three or four centuries old. So the potential for improvement in the next century is actually rather big.
item.source:markdown:
@trekonomics Instead of Longtermism, we need Zeydeism — how can we make the best future for our grandchildren and their peers 75 years hence?
@trekonomics The flip side is that the whole enlightenment project of working toward a better future is only three or four centuries old. So the potential for improvement in the next century is actually rather big.

item.description:
@trekonomics Well, African rates are trending down too. The hubris is thinking that that we are better positioned to solve the problems of a century hence than our descendants are.

@trekonomics One of the dangers of overvaluing the unborn, so a planet which settles into a stable 7 billion people is worse than one that settles at 10 billion.
item.source:markdown:
@trekonomics Well, African rates are trending down too. The hubris is thinking that that we are better positioned to solve the problems of a century hence than our descendants are.
@trekonomics One of the dangers of overvaluing the unborn, so a planet which settles into a stable 7 billion people is worse than one that settles at 10 billion.

item.description: @protecttruth_ I would say this is good news. “Rogue courts want to arm Texas teens against will of Republican legislature” is a better slogan than “Rogue Court wants to disempower the EPA”
item.source:markdown: @protecttruth_ I would say this is good news. “Rogue courts want to arm Texas teens against will of Republican legislature” is a better slogan than “Rogue Court wants to disempower the EPA”

item.description:
@trekonomics Given that most of my ancestors were (presumably) eaten by worms, it seems only fair.

@trekonomics (Two of my great grandparents, pictured posthumously here on the left, being among the exceptions.) https://t.co/x040C4mzfM
item.source:markdown:

item.description:
@nberlat People are not used to the fine print making govt policies look better.

@nberlat Starting to think the administration is legit playing chess these days, against Team R who can barely manage checkers.

@nberlat Note that unlike most efforts at “centrism,” the administration accepts the left frame that student debt is unfair and is sniping at the right.

@onthemainline Arguably simpler than remembering to reverse all the pages in your PDF — which can be done either by installing a script into Adobe Acrobat or printing the file as a PDF with pages reversed.
item.source:markdown: @onthemainline Arguably simpler than remembering to reverse all the pages in your PDF — which can be done either by installing a script into Adobe Acrobat or printing the file as a PDF with pages reversed.
